name: Sheraton Denarau Villas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we have just returned from a week at denarau staying at the sheraton villas. we were upgraded to a ground floor pool access unit, these are definately better than the lagoon view which is just a fish pond. Although on Fiji time anything we asked for we got and received a phone call after to confirm that we had received it ( for example a missing glass, ice bucket, milk for fridge). The rooms were spotless I am a clean freak especially bathrooms and it got the nod. everyday they clean the room and make up the beds etc., the resort is lovely attached to the original sheraton which is old and tired. unfortunately we had 5 out of 7 days of rain it was the week after the cyclone hit, even the locals couldn't believe the rain! so as it was our first time we didn't get to go on any island trips i would not recommend to go at this time of year (February) we will not go again then. The bonus was that you have other resorts close by that you can go and visit and the free bulla bus was a godsend in the rain it was so heavy walking was not really an option. Still after comparing other resorts we thought that we had chosen the best and most of the action is at the Westin which was right next door. the only other resort i would consider staying at would be the radisson but i still think the villas are better . I had considered staying at the coral coast and we hired a local taxi man for the day to take us there, we visited the shangri la fijian resort it is out on its own and well kept but looking a little old I was so happy that we chose Denarau as at least you could do more things rather than being stuck at one resort especially if the weather is bad. The coral coast resorts are all spread out and are not together like where we stayed about a 2 hour drive from denarau.
reviews.title: loved the sheraton villas and denarau

reviews.title: A relaxing break

reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the Sheraton Denarau Villas following our stay at Musket Cove Resort on Malolo Island and the difference was like chalk and cheese. The Sheraton Villas are very Sterile and Westernised in facilities and appearance. This is great if you want a holiday in the Sun with all the mod cons of home, but as a representation of Fiji it does not come close. If your are looking for Tropical Beaches then forget this as well, Denarau is surrounded by muddy beaches & water and the island exists solely for the large resorts and smaller residential enclaves. As the Sheraton is closed, you get to eat at the Westin next door. Breakfasts are included in the price which is full buffet, but the drinks at the Bars and dinners are outrageously expensive. My advice is to eat at the Golf club acros the road, or take the shuttle to the Marina where you have a choice of restauarnts.
reviews.title: Sterile & Not The Real Fiji

reviews.text: We loved the accomodation and the pools. The Resort is in bad need if a refurbishment which we believe will be sooner than later. The Villas are well planned out and provide everything you will need for your stay. The meals are very ordinary and do not justify the price you have to pay. Breakfast which was included in the price was average and we were invaded by birds daily so if you forget something then say goodbye to your breakfast. The staff smile alot and stand around but are very prompt to remove your plates wether you are finished or not. The "Toot- Toot " buses as we called them were great in getting from one resort to another and they cost nothing. Can not see us going there again or maybe we just chose the wrong resort /area in Fiji.
reviews.title: Friendliest Staff in Fiji

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Villas at each end of our holiday to Fiji.
reviews.title: Great stopover
Great Room but Food very Average
reviews.text: When staying in Fiji, we try to avoid staying on the mainland if possible, but sometimes we have to depending on our international flights. We found the Villas lovely. The rooms were very clean and tidy, the staff very friendly and willing to help you and the grounds & gardens well cared for. We have stayed at the Westin next door, which we prefer, as we thought was a little bit nicer. The Westin is more in keeping with the Fijian culture.

After reading previous reviews we booked at the Villas and made the right choice. I cant fault the rooms, service or the pools at the villas as they were great. The good thing about staying at the villas is you have access to the Sheraton Fiji and the Westin. The Westin was lovely but the Sheraton Fiji needs a makeover as its very tired looking. My only other gripe would be the prices for food! Very pricey for very average food - nothing special at all. Next time I think that we would look at staying on an island resort.....but had a great relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: Perfect experience. I'll be back!

reviews.text: In fact I did go back. I stayed here before Christmas just to visit Fiji en route to Sydney from LA. I fell in love with the place, the beautiful scenery, very friendly staff and exquisite rooms. I promised myself I'd go back. After the wedding I attended in Sydney, well, once the party was over and the fireworks were done, I decided to switch flights and spend a few more days there! this time I explored more and traveled the Islands. Awesome place. I still need to get back there. Rooms were reasonable prices and beautiful. Staff awesome. Loved the food, particularly the Indian buffet. This review also goes for the Sheraton Royal, I stayed both places - same complex and beach and amenities. I felt like royalty here. The staff, as I have already mentioned, were just wonderful.
reviews.title: great place

description: Sheraton Denarau Villas 82, two and three bedroom villas reflect the Pacific Island feel and from the comfort of the resort's luxuriously appointed self-contained villas to the waterfront infinity pool, 750m2 lagoon style pool, spa and 18 hole golf course, vacationers and families will be treated to an exciting choice of recreational options. The Villas feature a comfortable lounge with a fully equipped kitchen, dining area, flat screen, TV, DVD player and sound system, ensuit bathroom and laundry. What more could you ask for as your home away from home in paradise.
